meanings.definition: To relax or do nothing, especially by watching television.
meanings.sent1: After a long day, I vegged on the couch and watched my favorite show.
meanings.sent2: On weekends, I usually veg in front of the TV to unwind.
meanings.sent3: I vegged so much yesterday that I forgot to do my homework!
meanings.sent4: Her mind vegged out as she stared blankly at the screen.
meanings.sent5: The cat vegged lazily in the sun, enjoying the warmth.

meanings.definition: To spend time idly or passively.
meanings.sent1: During the holidays, I just vegged around the house with no plans.
meanings.sent2: Instead of working, he preferred to veg and daydream.
meanings.sent3: She vegged all afternoon, not realizing how quickly time passed.
meanings.sent4: The students vegged in the park, chatting and laughing.
meanings.sent5: The old dog vegged by the fireplace, content and peaceful.

meanings.sent3: The computer screen flickered, and then everything vegged out.
meanings.sent4: The monotonous task made her thoughts veg and wander.
meanings.sent5: As the day went on, his energy vegged, and he felt tired.
